attributes.action: get the Civil Aviation Aviation to grant 'Grandfather rights' to all UK PILOTS that currently fly Microlights,SSEA or SLMG on the basis of their UK based CAA Pilots Licences.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The CAA are currently looking like they are going to revoke the privileges of being able to fly Microlights,SSEA or SLMG aircraft on a CAA PPL(A)or higher rated licence after the 30th June 2009
See: http://www.caa.co.uk/docs/33/ORS4_689.pdf for further details.

This action is a contravention of PPL licence privileges and needs to be curtailed to ensure continued licence privileges of UK based PPL holders

rejection.details: This matter is the responsibility of the Civil Aviation Authority
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
